availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Josiah J. Boitnott (Caldwell County, Kentucky, pvt 1st Louisiana Cav CSA POW)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, soldier. Virginia native. Son of Ferdinand Boitnott and Mary Beckner Boitnott. Married to Louisa A. Davis Boitnott. Father of Louisa J. Boitnott and Mary Boitnott. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 1st Louisiana Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private. Captured January 28, 1863 in Caldwell County. POW at Camp Chase, Ohio, until sent to City Point, Virginia, for exchange on March 28, 1863.
